intro: Werneria pumila var. subspathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved werneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color.
